definition: to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: With eyes closed, repeat today's idea to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 先閉起眼睛，向你自己複誦今天的觀念。

sentences.english: Eyes slowly begin to shut, the canthus slides elapse a drop of radiant tears.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛慢慢的閉起，眼角滑過一滴晶瑩的淚。

sentences.english: You are even free when you close you eyes upon all there is.
sentences.chinese: 甚至當你閉起雙眼面對一切時，你還是自由的。

sentences.english: Sneezing is a reflex and so is closing our eyes.
sentences.chinese: 打噴嚏是一種本能反應，所以我們會本能地閉起雙眼。

sentences.english: The exercises for today are to be practiced with eyes closed throughout.
sentences.chinese: 今天的練習從頭到尾都是閉起眼睛來作的。
